thread.title: Cyclists Hold Food Drive In Downtown Sioux Falls
thread.title_full: Cyclists Hold Food Drive In Downtown Sioux Falls

title: Cyclists Hold Food Drive In Downtown Sioux Falls
text:
Cyclists Hold Food Drive In Downtown Sioux Falls October 10, 2015, 6:00 PM by Calah Kelley SIOUX FALLS, SD - 
A controversial comment inspired bikers to give back Saturday. 
Earlier this week in a piece from a local newspaper, a Lincoln County commissioner criticized bike lanes in Sioux Falls. Referring to vehicles and bikes, he said, "Hold a can of soup in one hand, and a raw egg in the other. Smack them together and my point is made." 
So Saturday, The MinusCar Project bike advocacy group hosted a canned food drive on Dakota Avenue between 10th and 11th street this morning. About 50 bikers donated items. 
These bikers say they should be able to share the road safely with drivers. But the event also aimed to raise food for those in need. Group members collected more than 300 cans total. 
They plan to donate the goods to Feeding South Dakota. Â© 2015 KELOLAND TV. All Rights Reserved.
